business.headline: Ford pauses shipments of SUVs, sports cars and other models to ChinaFord has halted exports of key US-built vehicles to China amid rising tariffs and trade tensions, impacting a once-profitable segment of its business, WSJ reports. Engine shipments, however, continue.
No GST on UPI transactions over Rs 2,000, government clarifiesUPI payments, especially those made to merchants, currently don't attract any extra charges like GST.

ICICI Bank cuts FD and savings rates. Check what's newIf you have a savings account with ICICI Bank, you'll now earn slightly less. For balances below Rs 50 lakh, the new interest rate is 2.75% per annum, down from 3%.

Infosys lets go of 240 new recruits, offers free upskilling: ReportThe impacted employees joined the company in October 2024 as part of a training batch. The freshers were hired for two roles; System Engineers (SE) and Digital Specialist Engineers (DSE).

Nvidia to keep serving Chinese firms despite massive AI chip export lossHuang's statement comes at a time when the United States has tightened rules around exporting advanced chips to China. The restrictions, announced under the Donald Trump administration, are part of an ongoing trade war between the two countries.

Want to change your tax regime while filing ITR? Here's what you should knowLet's say you had earlier chosen the old tax regime, but now the new regime appears more beneficial after reviewing your finances. Can you change it when filing your ITR? Let's find out here.

TCS denies job bias against US employees, calls allegations 'misleading': ReportThe complaints have mostly come from workers in the US who are over 40 and not of non-South Asian ethnic backgrounds. They believe TCS chose them for layoffs during the tech industry slowdown, while keeping younger Indian workers on H-1B visas.

How Jaggi brothers squandered borrowed money, killed BluSmartSebi's interim order exposed how the Jaggi brothers may have taken investors for a ride, not in an EV, but in a web of financial mismanagement.
Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

entertainment.headline: Khushboo Sundar alerts fans about suspicious activity after X account gets hackedActor and politician Khushboo Sundar's X account has been hacked. She shared an Instagram post to alert fans about any suspicious activity on her account.

Bridgerton's Nicola Coughlan slams JK Rowling for celebratory post over trans rulingActor Nicola Coughlan on Friday shared a note in her Instagram stories, asking 'Harry Potter' writer JK Rowling to keep her 'Harry Potter lads', after the latter made a celebratory post following the Supreme Court's trans-woman ruling.

Samantha visits Tirupati temple with director Raj NidimoruSamantha visited the Tirupati Balaji Temple along with filmmaker Raj Nidimoru on Saturday. Videos from their divine visit have surfaced on social media.

Priyanka Chopra-Mahesh Babu's latest update from SSMB29 has 'boat' connectionPriyanka Chopra Jonas, Mahesh Babu and Prithviraj Sukumaran are all set to begin the next shoot schedule for SS Rajamouli's next mythology-based film. Here's the latest update from their shoot schedule.

Kamal Haasan recalls being judged for marrying twice as Brahmin devotee of Lord RamDuring the promotions of Mani Ratnam's film 'Thug Life', actors Kamal Haasan, Trisha Krishnan, and Simbu shared their personal views on marriage. Kamal Haasan reflected on his past relationships and his stance on the institution of marriage.

Caste discrimination plagues our society: Phule director defends film amid rowDirector Ananth Mahadevan spoke about objections raised against the portrayal of caste-discrimination in his film, 'Phule'. The filmmaker said India's fight against discrimination is far from over.

Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko arrested in drugs caseMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko has been arrested by Kerala police. He was charged under Sections 27 and 29 of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

Jaat director says film was tweaked before backlash: No filmmaker wants to hurtJaat director Gopichand Malineni finally addressed the controversial church scene in the recently released film. An FIR was filed for allegedly hurting religious sentiments, leading to the scene's removal.
Sonakshi Sinha as Nikita Roy in brother Kussh's directorial debutSonakshi Sinha is gearing up for her next film, 'Nikita' Roy, which also marks the directorial debut of her brother, Kussh Sinha.

Urvashi Rautela says she was worshipped as 'Damdami Mai', reacts to temple remarkUrvashi Rautela's team released an official statement demanding legal action against those who took her remark on the 'Urvashi Temple' out of context. The actor's team further agreed with her claim about being worshipped as 'Damdami Mai' at Delhi University.

Deepika Padukone remembers Irrfan, announces Piku's re-release in theatresDeepika Padukone, Irrfan and Amitabh Bachchan's 'Piku' will re-release in theatres. The announcement was made by Deepika on April 19.

Ginny & Georgia 3 teaser: The mother-daughter duo return with more drama and twistsThe much-anticipated third season of 'Ginny and Georgia' is set to release soon on Netflix. The new teaser, released on Friday, promises more drama and excitement.

From lyrics to titles: How Bollywood plays on nostalgia and numerologyEver wondered why so many film titles sound like your favourite old songs? From catchy hooks to cosmic calculations, Bollywood filmmakers are increasingly turning to iconic lyrics as their film titles.

Kesari 2: The untold story of murder of history of Jallianwala BaghIn 'Kesari 2', director Karan Singh Tyagi puts together characters from completely different episodes of history, and gets confused between Brigadier General Reginald Dyer and Lt. Governor Michael O'Dwyer, and cooks up a fictitious trial that never happened.

Jaat box office Day 9: Sunny Deol's film sees minor dip due to Akshay's Kesari 2 'Jaat' faced a tough challenge from 'Kesari Chapter 2' at the box office on Friday. The Sunny Deol starrer could have performed better on its second Friday, also considering that it was a Good Friday holiday. However, it earned in the range of Rs 4 crore.

All about Anurag Kashyap's alleged casteist remark, and police complaintAnurag Kashyap has upset a section of people by allegedly making a casteist remark against Brahmins on social media while responding to a user. Now, a complaint has been filed against him with Mumbai Police seeking an FIR. Kashyap's apology on April 18 followed the complaint.

Kesari 2 box office Day 1: Akshay's film off to decent start amid positive responseAkshay Kumar and R Madhavan's 'Kesari Chapter 2' is expecting a weekend push amid a positive response from the audience after opening on a decent note at the box office.

Martha Stewart shades Katy Perry's space ride with throwback zero-gravity videoMartha Stewart subtly mocked Katy Perry's brief spaceflight by posting her own zero-gravity experience from 2006. The post reignited debate over celebrity space tourism and whether it merits the title "astronaut."

Jordan Peele's 'Him' turns NFL glory into nightmare in new horror thrillerJordan Peele's upcoming horror film Him follows a young footballer's twisted comeback under a mysterious NFL star's guidance, blending sports, fame, and psychological horror. It hits theaters on September 19.

general news.headline: Bizarre, barbaric: Bengal Governor after visit to riot-hit MurshidabadGovernor CV Ananda Bose said that his visit to the violence-hit border district came after he got contradictory reports of what actually transpired on the ground.

Amid 'Hindi imposition' row, Uddhav and Raj Thackeray hint at burying hatchetThe row over the Maharashtra government's decision to make Hindi a mandatory third language seems to have united warring first cousins Uddhav and Raj Thackeray.

Systematic persecution: India slams Bangladesh over Hindu leader's killingTwo days after a prominent Hindu leader was kidnapped and brutally killed in northern Bangladesh, India urged the Muhammed Yunus-led interim government to protect all minorities, including Hindus, 'without inventing excuses or making distinctions.'

The pull of prestige: Why everyone wants a piece of DLF CamelliasWhile the cynosure is, of course, the huge sum of money squandered by the Jaggi brothers, people can't help but pause for a moment and ask: what is it about this ultra-luxurious condominium, DLF Camellias, that sets a benchmark even for the crème de la crème of the country?
Why Indian parents are torn between CBSE and international boardsIn the past ten years, India has witnessed a 300% growth in IB and Cambridge schools, particularly in urban areas.
PM Modi to visit Saudi Arabia on April 22-23, defence cooperation on agendaPM Modi to visit Saudi Arabia on April 22-23, defence cooperation on agenda: Government

Kidnapped, taken to Nepal, declared dead: Bihar boy found alive after 70 daysA minor from Darbhanga, previously declared dead and cremated, has returned home safely after 70 days, revealing a shocking case of mistaken identity.

Kamal Haasan recalls being judged for marrying twice as Brahmin devotee of Lord RamDuring the promotions of Mani Ratnam's film 'Thug Life', actors Kamal Haasan, Trisha Krishnan, and Simbu shared their personal views on marriage. Kamal Haasan reflected on his past relationships and his stance on the institution of marriage.

Top court guardian of Constitution: Ex-judge on Vice President's judiciary remarkJustice Kurian Joseph, in an exclusive interview with India Today, asserted that the Supreme Court was correct to invoke Article 142 of the Constitution to pass the Tamil Nadu bills.

Elon Musk to visit India this year as Tesla readies debut, praises PM ModiThe Prime Minister's conversation with Elon Musk comes at a crucial juncture for both nations, as New Delhi and Washington are trying to erase differences on tariffs and work on convergences towards a trade deal.

Free from medicines: Amit Shah reveals weight-loss journey on World Liver DayRecollecting his journey towards fitness, Home Minister Amit Shah said that all it took was for him to change his diet, increase the hours of sleep and daily exercise.

Jaat director says film was tweaked before backlash: No filmmaker wants to hurtJaat director Gopichand Malineni finally addressed the controversial church scene in the recently released film. An FIR was filed for allegedly hurting religious sentiments, leading to the scene's removal.

Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko arrested in drugs caseMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko has been arrested by Kerala police. He was charged under Sections 27 and 29 of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

Abhishek Nayar joins KKR days after losing India assistant coach jobFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar has joined IPL team KKR, just days after getting sacked from the national team. Abhishek has coached at KKR before as well.

'Abusing Brahmins....': Anurag Kashyap's apology does little to soothe mattersFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap has faced backlash over his controversial remarks against Brahmins amid a row over the upcoming film 'Phule'.

Canadian vlogger calls India 'shocking', shares life lessons after 5-week tripA Canadian vlogger described India as "the most shocking" of the 37 countries he's visited. In a now-viral post on Instagram, he listed the life lessons he learned after a 5-week trip to the country.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

11 dead, several trapped as Delhi building collapses, 14 rescuedAccording to the police, at least 14 people have been rescued so far. Rescue teams from the NDRF, firefighters, and Delhi Police have rushed to the spot. The police further said that they are probing the cause behind the building's collapse.

50 certificates, 10 medals, no internship: Student's 'brutal truth' in viral postMarks may win you medals, but not always internships - at least that's what this Delhi University student learned the hard way.

From lyrics to titles: How Bollywood plays on nostalgia and numerologyEver wondered why so many film titles sound like your favourite old songs? From catchy hooks to cosmic calculations, Bollywood filmmakers are increasingly turning to iconic lyrics as their film titles.

Indian student, 21, killed by stray bullet in Canada, was 'innocent bystander'Hamilton Police said Harsimrat Randhawa was waiting at a bus stop when a stray bullet struck her during a shooting incident involving two vehicles.

Video: Arvind Kejriwal, wife Sunita burn up dance floor at daughter's engagementVideos from the wedding celebrations of his daughter, Harshita Kejriwal, have gone viral, showing the former Delhi Chief Minister dancing with his wife Sunita to the hit track 'Angaro Ka Ambar Sa' from the film Pushpa 2: The Rule.

Why Edappadi Palaniswami is reluctant to share power with BJP in Tamil NaduAs Tamil Nadu heads for 2026, talks of a coalition government loom large, even as AIADMK's Edappadi Palaniswami pushes back hard against BJP signals, desperate to hold his ground.

sports.headline: Jos Buttler takes sensational catch to dismiss Vipraj Nigam after howlersIPL 2025, DC vs GT: Jos Buttler took a sharp reflex catch in the match against Delhi Capitals (DC), helping Prasidh Krishna dismiss Vipraj Nigam for a golden duck at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

KL Rahul faster than MS Dhoni, AB de Villiers to hit 200 sixes in IPLIPL 2025, GT vs DC: KL Rahul hit his 200th six in the Indian Premier League in his 129th innings in the tournament. Rahul has gotten to the milestone faster than the likes of MS Dhoni and Sanju Samson.

Abhishek Nayar joins KKR days after losing India assistant coach jobFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar has joined IPL team KKR, just days after getting sacked from the national team. Abhishek has coached at KKR before as well.

WWE WrestleMania 41: All you need to know, match card, live streaming detailsWrestleMania 41 is all set to emanate from the Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, Nevada throughout two nights. Here's all you need to know about the Showcase of Immortals this year.

GT vs DC: Delhi drop Jake Fraser-McGurk a day after coach backs himIPL 2025, GT vs DC: Delhi Capitals dropped Jake Fraser-McGurk a day after head coach Hemang Badani backed the youngster despite his poor form. The Australian star has managed just 55 runs in six matches this season.

Kagiso Rabada to return in the last week of April: GT captain Shubman GillShubman Gill confirmed Kagiso Rabada's return is expected by the end of April, as Gujarat Titans manage well without their ace pacer. GT's clash against Delhi Capitals saw the absence of Rabada continue.

Bengaluru pitch the problem? Ex-coach highlights concerns for RCB in IPL 2025IPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Former batting coach Sanjay Bangar said RCB will be concerned about the nature of the pitches that have been on offer in Bengaluru. Traditionally batter-friendly pitches, the M Chinnaswamy Stadium pitch has helped bowlers more in the ongoing season.

Dented Rajasthan face big Lucknow challenge featuring a Mayank Yadav returnRR vs LSG, IPL 2025 match preview: With their IPL 2025 campaigns heading in different directions, RR and LSG prepare for a crucial Saturday clash in Jaipur—where momentum for one and survival for the other will be on the line.

RCB are slow learners: Hazlewood breaks down Chinnaswamy debacle after PBKS lossRoyal Challengers Bengaluru pacer Josh Hazlewood blamed his team's third consecutive home defeat on an unorthodox Chinnaswamy pitch and the batsmen's failure to apply what they had learned in prior matches.

Shush: R Ashwin stops panelist from talking about MS Dhoni during YouTube showIPL 2025: After having promised not to review Chennai Super Kings matches in his YouTube show, R Ashwin was careful when a panellist on his show started talking about MS Dhoni's captaincy.

KL Rahul-Kevin Pietersen banter goes on: DC star takes Maldives dig at mentorKL Rahul took a cheeky dig at Kevin Pietersen's Maldives break, joking about a mentor's "duties" during practice, continuing the light-hearted banter that's kept DC fans entertained throughout IPL 2025.

Scotland, England in talks over forming combined Britain team at LA OlympicsThe England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) and Cricket Scotland have started talks about forming a combined Britain cricket team for the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, Cricket Scotland CEO Trudy Lindblade confirmed on Friday.

Ravi Bishnoi going from strength to strength after slow start: LSG coach KlusenerLSG assistant coach Lance Klusener feels that Ravi Bishnoi is going from strength to strength after making a slow start to life in the IPL 2025 campaign. Bishnoi is slowly finding form.

Nehal Wadhera celebrates perfect outing vs RCB, poses with Virat KohliIPL 2025: From a composed match-winning knock to a fiery celebration and a wholesome post-match picture with Virat Kohli, Nehal Wadhera's night at the Chinnaswamy had all the makings of a memorable IPL moment.

IPL 2025: Nehal Wadhera's PBKS performance leaves senior Harpreet Brar proudHarpreet Brar said he feels proud to see Nehal Wadhera translate his domestic form into match-winning performances for PBKS in IPL 2025, proving why he's one of the team's most reliable young batters.

2024 to 2025: How Rahul completely changed his batting identity in 12 monthsDelhi Capitals' batter KL Rahul turned 32 on April 18, Friday. In the last 12 months, the batter has seen a massive transformation in his life, not only in terms of a cricketer but a human as well.

RCB's top 5-6 batters must bat for 20 overs: Josh Hazlewood on fixing home woesIPL 2025: Josh Hazlewood believes that RCB's fortunes at home can change if the top five to six batters play out the full 20 overs, controlling the innings and setting up a stronger platform for success.

Unreal feeling: Rohit Sharma honoured to have stand named after himDuring the inauguration of the Mumbai T20 League, Rohit Sharma said he was honoured after getting a stand named after him at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

IPL 2025: Nehal Wadhera's PBKS performance leaves senior Harpreet Brar proudHarpreet Brar said he feels proud to see Nehal Wadhera translate his domestic form into match-winning performances for PBKS in IPL 2025, proving why he's one of the team's most reliable young batters.

Unreal feeling: Rohit Sharma honoured to have stand named after himDuring the inauguration of the Mumbai T20 League, Rohit Sharma said he was honoured after getting a stand named after him at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

DC's fine start to IPL 2025 gives us cushion to back Fraser-McGurk: BadaniDC coach Hemang Badani feels that the team's fine start to IPL 2025 has given them the cushion to continue backing Jake Fraser-McGurk despite his poor form. Fraser-McGurk has struggled to get going this season after his impressive IPL 2024.

High-flyers Gujarat, Delhi face off in battle of contenders in AhmedabadIPL 2025, GT vs DC Match Preview: The high-flying GT and DC will square off at the Narendra Modi stadium in a battle of title contenders in IPL 2025. With both teams having superstars in their ranks, expect a thrilling contest in Ahmedabad on Saturday, April 19.

Kings on road, paupers at home: RCB's Chinnaswamy woes could cost them titleRCB continues to make the same mistakes at home as they suffered a third loss at the Chinnaswamy stadium on April 18 against PBKS. With their eyes on an elusive first title, Bengaluru need to make the Chinnaswamy a fortress quickly.

Alexander Zverev asks umpire to throw out heckler at Munich OpenGerman star Alexander Zverev complained to umpire Fergus Murphy after a fan heckled him during his Munich Open quarterfinal match on Friday against Tallon Griekspoor.

Tim David rewarded with POTM award despite RCB's defeat to PBKSIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Despite Bengaluru losing by 5 wickets, Tim David was rewarded with the Player of the Match award for scoring an unbeaten 50 and taking two catches against Punjab Kings.

Chahal's IPL 2025 turnaround: Shreyas Iyer reveals chat with PBKS spinnerPBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer revealed the chat he had with Yuzvendra Chahal as the leg-spinner continues his comeback in the IPL 2025 season. Chahal picked up two wickets against RCB on Friday, April 18.

RCB's disastrous home run continues as PBKS triumph in rain-marred gameIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) lost their third match in a row at home as Punjab Kings (PBKS) won by five wickets in the rain-marred contest on Friday at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Vintage RCB is back: Memes galore as PBKS run through hosts in BengaluruFans on social media trolled RCB after they crumbled against PBKS at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Friday, April 18. The likes of Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar and others failed on the night as RCB scored 95 in the 14-over game.

Arshdeep Singh gets Virat Kohli after scripting history for Punjab KingsIPL 2025, RCB vs PBKS: Arshdeep Singh took the wicket of Phil Salt to become the all-time top wicket-taker for the Punjab Kings, after which he also accounted for the wicket of Virat Kohli.

LSG have the team to win IPL 2025: Assistant coach Klusener makes bold claimLSG assistant coach Lance Klusener feels that Lucknow has the team to go all the way in IPL 2025 and win their first title. LSG have won 4 out of their 7 matches and remain in the hunt for a place in the playoffs.

RCB vs PBKS: No Bengaluru return as Maxwell dropped, Stoinis returnsThere will be no Bengaluru return for Glenn Maxwell as the Australian all-rounder was dropped for the clash between RCB and PBKS at the Chinnaswamy stadium on Friday, April 18. Maxwell has been in poor form this season.

BCCI bans former Mumbai T20 League team franchise owner for fixing attemptGurmeet Singh Bhamrah, a former co-owner of a Mumbai T20 League franchise, has been banned for making corrupt approaches to Dhawal Kulkarni and Bhavin Thakkar during the event's 2019 edition.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
